newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Ivernia gets go-ahead for lead/zinc mine.
newsitem.headline: Ivernia gets go-ahead for lead/zinc mine.

text.p: Ivernia West Plc and Minorco Lisheen Ltd said on Thursday that they had received planning permission for the development of a lead/zinc mine from Tipperary County Council.
Ivernia and joint venture partner South African owned mining-based conglomerate Minorco SA said they plan to advance the project to the development stage at an early date.
Both firms have a 50 percent interest in the Lisheen project.
In a joint statement the companies said they were pleased with the positive response to the planning application which was submitted in January 1996.
The statement said the development will generate more than 700 construction related jobs in the North Tipperary region.
Ivernia set a 41.25 million punt rights issue in July to finance its share of the construction and development cost of the Lisheen project.
